snippet: Mitt Romney, in an interview, used imprecise language on what his red line is on Iran’s nuclear program, saying it was acquisition of a weapon, not “capability,” as his aides have said.
abstract: Mitt Romney struggles to differentiate his policy on Iran, regarding its attempts to acquire nuclear weapons, from Pres Obama's stated positions and policies, in an interview with ABC News; Romney uses imprecise language that blurs critical distinctions between his stand and that of Pres Obama.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney, in an interview, used imprecise language on what his red line is on Iran’s nuclear program, saying it was acquisition of a weapon, not “capability,” as his aides have said.

headline.seo: Romney Struggles to Distinguish Iran Red Line From Obama’s
headline.main: Romney Stumbles in Explaining Iran Policy
